cleaned_text: A Smear Test Could Save Your Life by Public Health Scotland published on 2016-06-20T11:33:56Z Cervical screening is also known as the 'smear test'. The test checks the cells from your cervix (the neck of the womb). It's designed to pick up any changes to the cells in your cervix so that they can be monitored or treated. Without treatment the changes can sometimes develop into cervical cancer. This publication is licensed for re-use under the Open Government Licence v3.0. For
